instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.message: brand new cap. used an old cap from a ps3, tried a ceramic. same stuff. doesn't solve the kernel panic. what could it be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> kernel panic even after replacing  <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>
threads.message:
ok after a FIGHT against this machine here is what happened:

replaced the cap many times with different stuff..no change.

reflowed mux after removing edge bonding. machine worked fine for 15min. then dead.  turned back on to:

[img]https://i.imgur.com/FJl7OCC.jpg[/img]

reballed and worked fine.. for 30mins or so.. then it died again. completely. getting a quarter span left and right thing. repalced from a donor 
[img]https://i.imgur.com/V6itfTn.jpg[/img]

and so far no crashes... will test many more hours and see if the mux was the cause

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ge5CPwu.jpg[/img]
